      • formatedStringToDate

        public static java.util.Calendar formatedStringToDate(java.lang.String stringDate)
        Convert a string with format yyyy/MMM/dd (CAUTION month with characters, e.g JAN, FEB...) to a java calendar! Example of date 2015/Jan/02 year 2015, month 01 (Jan), day 02.
        Parameters:
        stringDate - - String with the format yyyy/MMM/dd.
        Returns:
        - Calendar with the date passed.

      • formatedStringDBToCalendar

        public static java.util.Calendar formatedStringDBToCalendar(java.lang.String stringDate)
        Convert a string with format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS used in Mysql database to a java calendar!
        Parameters:
        stringDate - - String with the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS.
        Returns:
        - Calendar with the date passed.

      • formatedPostStringToDate

        public static java.util.Calendar formatedPostStringToDate(java.lang.String stringDate)
        Convert a string post date with format E, MMM dd yyyy to a java calendar! Example of date: Fri, June 7 2013.
        Parameters:
        stringDate - - String with the format E, MMM dd yyyy.
        Returns:
        - Calendar with the date passed.

      • verifyIfDateIsBetweenStartAndStopDate

        public static boolean verifyIfDateIsBetweenStartAndStopDate(java.util.Calendar analyseDate,
                                                            java.util.Calendar startDate,
                                                            java.util.Calendar stopDate)
        Verify if one date is between two dates (start date and stop date).
        Parameters:
        analyseDate - - Date to by analyzed.
        startDate - - Start date period.
        stopDate - - Stop date period.
        Returns:
        True if analysed date is between startDate and stopDate or False if not!

      • getDateMinusAmountOfDays

        public static java.util.Calendar getDateMinusAmountOfDays(java.util.Calendar dateToBeReduced,
                                                          int amountDaysToBeReduced)
        Given a date reduce this date in an amount of days and return this reduced date.
        Parameters:
        dateToBeReduced - - Date that will be reduced.
        amountDaysToBeReduced - - Quantity of days to be reduced of dateToBeReduced.
        Returns:
        - A new date that is the result of dateToBeReduced minus amountDaysToBeReduced.

      • verifyIfTimerExpired

        public static boolean verifyIfTimerExpired(java.util.Calendar verifyDate,
                                           java.lang.String datePeriod)
        Verify is one time is after that current time, is used like a timer!
        Parameters:
        verifyDate - - Date to be verify.
        datePeriod - - Just a text to identify the process!
        Returns:
        - true if current date is greater than verified date (expired timer), or false if not (not expired timer)!

        public static boolean verifyIfOnlyYearMonthDayAreEquals(java.util.Calendar date1,
                                                        java.util.Calendar date2)
        Verify if dates are equals, but just analyzing the Year, Month, and Day!
        Parameters:
        date1 - - One date to be analyzed.
        date2 - - Another date to be analyzed.
        Returns:
        - True if are equals, False if not!
